column4: I have an IPod video, and I've tried using both gtkpod and Amarok to play music (most imported from .mp3s to the IPod).  However, I get an error that the files can't be played.  Is there a codecs I can get that supports playing music from the IPod?
Can you play mp3's from your harddisk?
then you should not need additional codes. Does your ipod show up as a device in amarok?
are you sure the files are not in the m4a format?
what did you use to copy the files onto the ipod?
It should not have converted the files if they were originally in mp3 format. Can you copy mp3's from your HD to the ipod?
most strange. Usually when amarok cannot play a file it has to do with unsupported formats and/or codecs not installed. In your case, this does not seem to be the problem, right?
Nope. If it's mp3 and your ipod is correctly detected in amarok, there should be no problem
when you first tried to play mp3 in amarok, did it ask if you wanted to install additional codecs?
see my subsequent question about installing additional codecs when first playing mp3's in amarok
it installs all the necessary codecs for a range of audio and video formats
if playing mp3's from your ipod does not work after installing libxine1-ffmpeg, it is not a codecs problem
